title: Philippines: Passenger ship engulfed by fire at Ormoc port, 2 minor injuries reportedTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Philippines: Passenger ship engulfed by fire at Ormoc port, 2 minor injuries reported
A two-story passenger ship caught fire after docking in the central Philippines early Saturday (Aug 15). The passenger ship, owned by Roble Shipping, was carrying more than 500 passengers when fire engulfed it at Ormoc port.
Video footage showed several men jumping into the water from the MV Wonderful Stars. All passengers were safe and only two crew members suffered bruises and cuts, officials said.
According to Senior Fire Officer 3 Roberto Ygoana, the fire started at the bottom of the ship where the cargo is placed.
Capt. William Isaga, commander of the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) Eastern Visayas, said the maritime casualty investigation team and the Maritime Industry Authority will investigate the incident.
Last month, a ferry was lashed by strong waves and capsized moments after departing Ormoc, leaving more than 60 people dead.
